New Records: The Padres tied a single-game MLB postseason record by hitting six home runs in a road playoff game.
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. was plunked by a Jack Flaherty fastball, sparking a shouting match between Machado and Flaherty in the bottom of the sixth.
Fans in the left-field seats threw baseballs in the direction of Padres left fielder Jurickson Profar.
Manny Machado called an impromptu meeting with the Padres roster prior to the eighth inning.
The Padres held a two-run lead into the sixth when things got heated.
Play was halted when two baseballs and various other objects were thrown onto the field in the seventh.
Manny Machado lined the first hit of the eighth inning, followed by home runs from Merrill and Bogaerts.
Higashioka and Tatis hit home runs in the ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
The Padres might hold an edge, with the current 2-2-1 format favoring the team heading home for Games 3-4.
Post-Match Reflections: The Padres won the 2022 NLDS in four games after losing Game 1 at Dodger Stadium.
Darvish also pitched them to a Game 2 victory in that series.
The Padres tied a single-game MLB postseason record by hitting six home runs.
The team held an edge in the series with the current 2-2-1 format.

The Padres poured it on for a statement 10-2 victory in Game 2 of the National League Division Series.
The red-hot Shohei Ohtani finished 0-for-4 with two strikeouts.
The Padres held a two-run lead into the sixth when things got heated.
The Padres got what they came for: a split in L.A.
